creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Charles S. Pillsbury
markings: black stamp, at lower right [YB], Lugt 421 (Beurdeley)
provenance: Emmanuel Alfred (Alfred II) Beurdeley (1847-1919), Lugt 421, Paris (until '1920 or 1921, his sale, July 2-3, 1920 or June 21-22, 1921, Delteil, Paris). Mrs. Charles Stinson Pillsbury (née Nelle Pendleton Winston), Minneapolis (until d. 1957; bequeathed to Mia)
signed: Signed with initials and dated in plate: AB / 1886; signed with graphite below: ABesnard
text: This intimate portrait presents the artist’s wife, Charlotte, in a private moment, eyes closed and head propped on a pillow. Besnard must have admired his wife’s profile. He depicted her from this angle, in both paintings and prints, no less than six time. Sargent showed her in profile too.
title: Madame Besnard (Charlotte Dubray Besnard) in a Medallion
